result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Gauthier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive to: any other time being served
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATIN/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Obtain Mental health assessment- complete follow-up treatment. Take any and all prescription medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physician.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan. Complete follow-up treatment.

Absolute sobriety, no drugs or alcohol- random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses). No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or  full time school with part time work.
Court ordered restitution in the stipulated amount of $800.00 payable to Gary S. - to be paid first.

Provide DNA sample if not previously submitted; pay surcharge. Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge and $17.50 to West Allis Police Department (reimbursement for lab testing). Pay all supervision fees. Court related costs and restitution to be paid by the end of probation period.  Any amount remaining to convert to civil judgment.

If revoked, Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

timeConds.notes:
With release privileges to Day Reporting Center for treatment. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

****November 4 2014 Judge William Brash; IT IS ORDERED that defendant is granted 'good time' credit while serving this conditional time****

records.addlTxt:
Granting Motion for Good Time Credit, signed and filed.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant is granted good time credit for the nine-month conditional jail term.  The clerk's office shall send an amended judgment of conviction to the House of Correction.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for good time credit.
Denying Motion for Sentence Credit, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
BAIL REFUND PACKET, FILED
WCS Report received and filed.
WCS INTOXICATED DRIVER INTERVENTION PROGRAM REPORT, FILED

Defendant Darrell Gauthier in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 21:  Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.    Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Filed Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to poster.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darrell Gauthier in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter set for Plea hearing.  Defense indicates that the defendant would like to retain private counsel.  The Court grants request for adjournment.  Defendant advised by the court that if new counsel is retained said counsel to appear at the next hearing.  WCS report reviewed with the parties; defendant in compliance at this time.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.
WCS Report, received and filed.

14RM022222  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-24-14
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ALL PREVIOUSLY ORDERED BAIL CONDITIONS REMAIN.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Darrell Gauthier not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel off the record.  On the record.  Bail argument of the parties heard.  The Court ordered cash bail set at $500.00 with tot WCS and all other previously ordered conditions continued.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS report received and filed.

Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.

Case set for bail-bond hearing / address SCRAM violation report.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
with Attorney S. Sargent.  WCS Violation report filed with the court on 4-15-14.  Bail bond hearing scheduled for 4-17-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Defendant Darrell Gauthier in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Katie Shaw, student intern under the supervision of Megan Carmody for Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Foy-West Allis Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 3/26/14.

IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.
